author: Joanne Kaufman
title: Summer Books: Beach Reading
text:
Summer. At last. And nothing could be finer than sitting on the porch of your home by the sea reading a charmer of a novel about a woman who would love to be reading a novel on the porch of her seaside home. And right there is the conflict that animates “The High Season” (Random House, 396 pages, $27) by Judy Blundell, a National Book Award winner in 2008 for the young-adult novel “What I Saw and How I Lied.”
The only way that Ruthie Beamish, a mid-40ish museum director, can hold on to her heavily mortgaged house on the North...
